result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quantae Tashiro Hines

records.addlTxt:
HAVING DETERMINED THAT DEFENDANT QUANTAE HINES
 IS ENTITLED ACCESS TO ELECTRONIC DISCOVERY IN THIS CASE, Received and Filed

Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court for Quantae Tashiro Hines.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant requests for Defense Counsel to withdraw from case. Defense Counsel filed a motion to withdraw. Court acknowledges the motion. Court agrees to grant the motion once Defense Counsel turns over Discovery to the Defendant. 

Matter is adjourned for a Status Of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL, received and filed.

Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court in person for Quantae Tashiro Hines.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective T. McClain and MPD Detective J. Pusching. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 06.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines not in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, appeared in person for Quantae Tashiro Hines. Paul Leonard Tiffin in court, appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant tested POSITIVE for COVID. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

New counsel is appointed.  Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
PD's Office contacted the court requesting time to appoint counsel.  The matter was adjourned OFF THE RECORD via email.  Next court date is 8/15/22 at 8:30am.
Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 15:

Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines in court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed.  Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Statements to the Court by defense counsel as to attempts to appoint counsel as to this case.

Statements to the Court by defendant requesting case be transferred to another county and requesting public defender be withdrawn.  Further, defendant is requesting a preliminary hearing.
Court advises defendant that these issues can be addressed after appointment of counsel.

Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE and adjourned for status of counsel.
Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 15.

Clerk:  jms
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines not in court, defendant in custody.  Paul Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; OVERRIDE FOR VICTIM SAFETY; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Quantae Tashiro Hines in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Quantae Tashiro Hines appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
     99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Sharonda H.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
